Authors: Otey, A; Houser, Js; Jones, C; Evans, Dc; Dalal, Pp; Whitmill, Ma; Levine, Ej; Mckimmie, Rl; Papadimos, Tj; Steinberg, Sm; Bergese, Sd; Stawicki, Sp
Title: Republication: Examination Of Financial Charges Associated With Intentional Foreign Body Ingestions By Prisoners: A Pattern Of Escalation
Comments: Cost analysis. Overlapping populations with Study_ID 192. Only examines hospital charges, not rates of complication, surgery or endoscopy, or object characterists or motivation.

Authors: Hsieh, A; Hsiehchen, D; Layne, S; Ginsberg, Gg; Keo, T
Title: Trends And Clinical Features Of Intentional And Accidental Adult Foreign Body Ingestions In The United States, 2000 To 2017
Comments: Looks at trends of accidental and intentional foreign body ingestion from 2000 to 2017. Does not report granular detail of outcomes or motivations following intentional foreign body ingestion, instead uses data from 17 year US public database sample to estimate USA-wide incidence of IIFO, th objects ingested therein and the population characterists of those that ingest. Does not give seperate granular detail on IIFO. Exclude. Review with supervisor.

Authors: Karb, Daniel; Delozier, Sara; Raad, Dany; Dumot, John; Mok, Shaffer
Title: Effect Of Delayed Endoscopy Protocol On Timing And Safety Of Endoscopy For Foreign Body Ingestion And Esophageal Food Impaction
Comments: Single centre atudy of foreign body algorithm for reduction of out of hours endoscopy rats. Includes only patients that underwent OGD. Contains 82/358 cases of intentional ingestion that underwent endoscopy. Mix of oesophaegeal food impaction and IIFO. Motivation and type of object not elaborated on. Exclude. Review with supervisor.

Authors: Tambakis, George; Schildkraut, Tamar; Delaney, Isabella; Gilmore, Robert; Loebenstein, Moshe; Taylor, Andrew; Holt, Bronte; Tsoi, Edward H.; Cameron, Georgina; Demediuk, Barbara; Miller, Ashley; Connell, William; Wright, Emily; Thompson, Alexander; Holmes, Jacinta
Title: Management Of Foreign Body Ingestion In Adults: Time To Stop And Rethink Endoscopy
Comments: Retrospective, single-centra australian study of management and complications following ingestion of foreign object. Some intentional ingestions included, but does not report rates of intentional ingestion in this mixed population.

Authors: Jaini, Paresh A.; Haliburton, James; Rush, A. John
Title: Management Challenges Of Recurrent Foreign Body Ingestions In A Psychiatric Patient: A Case Report
Comments: Prolonged case report. 18F repeated intentional ingestions in one case. Documentation of one hospital course with repeated ingestions during. Difficult to get data on individual ingestions, so statistics used to average characteristics across each ingestion.

Title: Management Of Deliberate Foreign Body Ingestion Requiring Endoscopic Retrieval
Comments: Single Centre UK review of deliberate foreign body ingestion. Primary aim was to: aim was to identify the timeframes and barriers in escalation and management of these high-risk patients from the point of presentation, with a view to highlighting new strategies to improve clinical outcomes and reduce prolonged admissions. Exclude. Review with supervisor.
